trans-unit.source: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Connect a web app to an API app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in [App Service](../app-service.md).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to consume an API app from an ASP.NET web app hosted in [App Service](../app-service.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds upon the series from the API App tutorials:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds upon the series from the API App tutorials:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure API App
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure API App

trans-unit.source: Deploy an Azure API App
trans-unit.target: Deploy an Azure API App

trans-unit.source: Debug an Azure API App
trans-unit.target: Debug an Azure API App

trans-unit.source: Make the API app publicly accessible
trans-unit.target: Make the API app publicly accessible

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715), select the API app.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715), select the API app.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Settings** button in the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Settings** button in the command bar.

trans-unit.source: In the **Application Settings** blade, change the **Access Level** to **Public (anonymous)**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Application Settings** blade, change the **Access Level** to **Public (anonymous)**.

trans-unit.source: Create an ASP.NET MVC Application in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Create an ASP.NET MVC Application in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Use the **New Project** dialogue to add a new **ASP.NET Web Application**.
trans-unit.target: Use the **New Project** dialogue to add a new **ASP.NET Web Application**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: File > New > Web > ASP.NET Web Application
trans-unit.target: File > New > Web > ASP.NET Web Application

trans-unit.source: Select the **MVC** template.
trans-unit.target: Select the **MVC** template.

trans-unit.source: Click **Change Authentication**, then select **No Authentication**, and then click **OK** twice.
trans-unit.target: Click **Change Authentication**, then select **No Authentication**, and then click **OK** twice.

trans-unit.source: New ASP.NET Application
trans-unit.target: New ASP.NET Application

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the newly created Web Application project and select **Add Azure App Reference**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the newly created Web Application project and select **Add Azure App Reference**.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure API App Reference...
trans-unit.target: Add Azure API App Reference...

trans-unit.source: In the **Existing API Apps** dropdown list, select the API App you would like to connect to.
trans-unit.target: In the **Existing API Apps** dropdown list, select the API App you would like to connect to.

trans-unit.source: Select Existing API App
trans-unit.target: Select Existing API App

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The client code for connecting to the API app will be automatically generated from a Swagger API endpoint.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The client code for connecting to the API app will be automatically generated from a Swagger API endpoint.

trans-unit.source: To leverage the generated API code, open the HomeController.cs file and replace the `Contact` action with the following:
trans-unit.target: To leverage the generated API code, open the HomeController.cs file and replace the `Contact` action with the following:

trans-unit.source: HomeController.cs Code Updates
trans-unit.target: HomeController.cs Code Updates

trans-unit.source: Update the `Contact` view to reflect the dynamic list of contacts with the code below:
trans-unit.target: Update the `Contact` view to reflect the dynamic list of contacts with the code below:

trans-unit.source: // Add to the very top of the view file
trans-unit.target: // Add to the very top of the view file

trans-unit.source: @model IList<MyContactsList.Web.Models.Contact>
trans-unit.target: @model IList<MyContactsList.Web.Models.Contact>

trans-unit.source: // Replace the default email addresses with the following
trans-unit.target: // Replace the default email addresses with the following

trans-unit.source: <h3>Public Contacts</h3>
trans-unit.target: <h3>Public Contacts</h3>

trans-unit.source: <ul>
trans-unit.target: <ul>

trans-unit.source: @foreach (var contact in Model)
trans-unit.target: @foreach (var contact in Model)

trans-unit.source: <li><a href="mailto:@contact.EmailAddress">@contact.Name &lt;@contact.EmailAddress&gt;</a></li>
trans-unit.target: <li><a href="mailto:@contact.EmailAddress">@contact.Name &lt;@contact.EmailAddress&gt;</a></li>

trans-unit.source: </ul>
trans-unit.target: </ul>

trans-unit.source: Contact.cshtml Code Updates
trans-unit.target: Contact.cshtml Code Updates

trans-unit.source: Deploy the web application to Web Apps in App Service
trans-unit.target: Deploy the web application to Web Apps in App Service

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions available at [How to Deploy an Azure web app](web-sites-deploy.md).
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions available at [How to Deploy an Azure web app](web-sites-deploy.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
